abstract.p: Arts Briefing column; JVC Jazz Festival announces its New York series lineup, which will run from June 15 through June 26 and include perfomances by Ornette Coleman, Abbey Lincoln, Lou Reed and Joao Gilberto; photo (M)

block.p: Ornette Coleman, below, Abbey Lincoln, Lou Reed, João Gilberto, Oscar D'Leon, K. D. Lang, Bill Charlap, Herbie Hancock, Wayne Shorter, Dave Holland and Brian Blade are among the more than 300 musicians who will perform in the JVC Jazz Festival, it was announced yesterday. The festival, which was founded in Newport, R.I., in 1954 by George Wein, moved to New York in 1972 and is still run by Mr. Wein and his company, Festival Productions. The New York series, in nearly 60 concerts at Carnegie Hall, Lincoln Center, the Beacon Theater and more than a dozen other locations, will run from June 15 through 26. Other highlights include a tribute to Nina Simone with Tracy Chapman, Toni Morrison, Lizz Wright and others; Dianne Reeves in a tribute to Sarah Vaughan; and an African concert at the Apollo Theater with Angélique Kidjo and Femi Kuti. The full schedule is online, at festivalproductions.net. Tickets go on sale today, and are available at (212) 501-1390.

Along with George Wein, whose company still runs it, Elaine and Louis Lorillard were founders.
